pr_title: Account for replica state when randomly selecting writable partition

timeline.message:
Account for replica state when randomly selecting writable partition

Previously writable partition is selected based on 1. partition state(read-write)
2.replicas of partition are up. This logic is correct in most cases but may have
two minor issues: (1) replicas are up but not in a required state for PUT. (2)
replica is actually down but failure detector temporarily marks it up after backoff.
This PR introduces 3rd criterion that ensures alive replicas are in eligible states
for PUT operation. Together with previous two criteria, the partition selection logic
is able to preclude some unsatisfied partitions.

timeline.bodyText:
This is a nitpick. Feel free to ignore, if you don't feel like it.
I would suggest that either we name both methods (getRandomWritablePartition, hasEnoughEligibleReplicasForPut) to one of these names

(getRandomWritablePartition, hasEnoughEligibleWritableReplicas)
(getRandomPartitionForPut, hasEnoughEligibleReplicasForPut)

But if we decide to take approach 2, then we should also rename these:
ClusterMap::getRandomWritablePartition to ClusterMap::getRandomPartitionForPut
PartitionLayout::getRandomWritablePartition to PartitionLayout::getRandomPartitionForPut
